channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: What we talk about when we talk about sideloading
item.description:
They follow-up with a blog post: Does this mean sideloading is going away on Android. What this means for your rights You, the consumer, purchased your Android device believing in Google’s promise that it was an open computing platform and that you could run whatever software you choose on it. But Google clearly feels that they have enough of a lock on the Android ecosystem, along with sufficient regulatory capture, that they can now jettison this principle with prejudice and impunity.

Read more

item.title: Why do some radio towers blink?
item.description:
Is that similar on towers. Red light, white light. And an example is the tower that you're talking about.

Read more

item.title: Mapping the off-target effects of every FDA-approved drug in existence
item.description:
StartupsMapping the off-target effects of every FDA-approved drug in existence (EvE Bio)6. What does this discovery process ignore. Simply put: everything else a drug could do beyond that.

Read more

item.title: Boring Is What We Wanted
item.description:
Those first Apple silicon Macs looked like the Intel machines they replaced, but they were better in every single way. Before the Apple silicon introduction, we all wanted steady, predictable progress in Mac hardware development. For the most part, Apple has delivered.

Read more

item.title: Fil-C: A memory-safe C implementation
item.description:
This has given Fil-C reputation for slowness. 32 with Fil-C and tried using it as my shell. Since Fil-C is a full implementation of C and C++ at the source-code level, however, in practice this just requires everything to be recompiled with Fil-C.

Read more

item.title: Samsung makes ads on $3,499 smart fridges official with upcoming software update
item.description:
The ads will arrive through a software update that Samsung will start issuing this month and display on the fridge’s integrated 21. Samsung also said that its fridges will only show contextualized ads, instead of personalized ads, which rely on collecting data on users. The Verge reported that this feature will also include ads, something that Samsung’s announcement neglected to state.

Read more

item.title: Inside Amazon's engineering culture: Lessons from their senior principals
